alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SMYTH...SOUTHWESTERN WYTHE AND CENTRAL GRAYSON COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Rogers Summit, or 8 miles northeast of Whitetop, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion... Rural Retreat... Independence... Whitetop... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... and Troutdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
